solution_line_template: Luke started putting together, {total_pieces} x {first_day_percent} = <<{total_pieces}*{first_day_percent}={pieces_first_day}>>{pieces_first_day} pieces.
The next day, there were {total_pieces}-{pieces_first_day} = <<{total_pieces}-{pieces_first_day}={pieces_remaining_after_first_day}>>{pieces_remaining_after_first_day} pieces left.

Then he put together {pieces_remaining_after_first_day} * {second_day_percent} = <<{pieces_remaining_after_first_day}*{second_day_percent}={pieces_second_day}>>{pieces_second_day} pieces on the second day.
On the third day, he put together {pieces_remaining_after_second_day} * {third_day_percent} = <<{pieces_remaining_after_second_day}*{third_day_percent}={pieces_third_day}>>{pieces_third_day} pieces.

Therefore, Luke still has {pieces_remaining_after_second_day} - {pieces_third_day} = <<{pieces_remaining_after_second_day}-{pieces_third_day}={pieces_left_final}>>{pieces_left_final} pieces left to complete the puzzle.
